summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackBeautyStat's Universal C Eye Perfector is a powerful eye treatment with peptides and 5% stable L-ascorbic acid targets crow's feet, lines and dark circles. Enhanced with Glabridin and optical diffusers for instant results. Refreshes and rejuvenates the eye area.
details: DetailsBenefitsVisibly reduces dark circles and under-eye shadowsStrengthens and firms the delicate eye areaInstantly brightens with optical diffusersImproves the appearance of fine lines and wrinklesReduces visible signs of fatigue and puffinessSupports natural collagen productionProvides antioxidant protectionFormulated for all skin tones, textures and typesDermatologist-TestedPackaging may varyKey Ingredients5% Vitamin CCMH ComplexCaffeine, Magnolia, Hyaluronic AcidPeptidesGlabridinphytosphingosineResearch Results84% of subjects showed improvement in skin brightness and radiance81% of subjects showed improvement in skin tone and clarity71% of subjects showed improvement in under-eye discoloration (dark circles)Item 2636493How To UseApply to clean, dry skin morning and night. Gently pump 1-2 drops onto your fingertip and dot product under and around eyes. Using light pressure, pat and smooth in an upward circular motion around the orbital bone. The lightweight texture spreads easily - a little goes a long way to cover the entire eye area.Packaging may varyIngredientsDimethicone, Polysilicone-11, Ascorbic Acid, Mica, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Silica, C13-15 Alkane, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Palmitoyl Tripeptide-1, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide-7, Magnolia Grandiflora Bark Extract, Linoleic Acid, Punica Granatum (Pomegranate) Sterols, Phytosphingosine, Caffeine, Creatine, Sodium Hyaluronate, Glabridin, Tartaric Acid, Hydroxyapatite, Hordeum Distichon (Barley) Extract, Triticum Vulgare (Wheat) Germ Oil, Squalane, Amaranthus Caudatus Seed Oil, C12-15 Alkyl Benzoate, Titanium Dioxide (Ci 77891), C9-12 Alkane, Caprylyl Glycol, Disteardimonium Hectorite, Sorbitan Laurate, Pentaerythrityl Tetraisostearate, C18-36 Acid Triglyceride, C18-36 Acid Glycol Ester, Triethyl Citrate, Tin Oxide, Iron Oxide (Ci 77491).Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Apply to clean, dry skin morning and night. Gently pump 1-2 drops onto your fingertip and dot product under and around eyes. Using light pressure, pat and smooth in an upward circular motion around the orbital bone. The lightweight texture spreads easily - a little goes a long way to cover the entire eye area.Packaging may vary

reviews.headline: A pre-makeup must
reviews.comments: I LOVE this product for a specific reason. I thought this would be a good eye cream, but the texture is a little matte so I've been using it as an under eye primer and it makes my makeup look so good. It blurs out my fine lines and I look more rested

reviews.headline: BURNS AND STINGS
reviews.comments: I received a sample of this. It burned my skin like no product ever has. I had to stop using it.

reviews.headline: Gritty and dry
reviews.comments: I really did not like this (dry) serum.  I don't like the texture at all.  It feels gritty and things tend to pill on it.  Since I want to use it under makeup, that is a problem.  I think the science behind it is good, otherwise it would have been one star only.

reviews.headline: Texture
reviews.comments: I received a sample of this. I am in need of products  to help with dark circles and bags. I don't like the texture, which is course like sandpaper. I've begun taking Vitamin C pills. Maybe that will help.

reviews.headline: Love it!!
reviews.comments: I love it. It's so much moisturizing.

reviews.headline: Best vita c eye product!!
reviews.comments: So, I've been using this for over 3 years off and on!! You MUST start slow.. I tolerate tretinion 1%and use a lot of glycolic acids, but this took some time, now im able to use even on eyelids.. works incredibly, brightens, helps a lot with crows feet and eyelids!!! Great product!!

reviews.headline: RUN!!
reviews.comments: Would definitely recommend this to everyone! It does everything they claim it does. 10/10 you won't regret it.

reviews.headline: Read excellent things!
reviews.comments: I've done a lot of research on this brand and the reviews seem to outshine other brands.  I'm so excited to try it.  I have a friend who is in love with all their products already!

reviews.headline: Has shimmer in product
reviews.comments: I wanted to like this but the prodcut has shimmer in it and there is no reason why an eyecream should have shimmer in it. Also the dispensor is really bad the product is runny so when you press the pump you get wayyy more prodcut then you need so your wasting product, lastly the product stinged my eyes.

reviews.headline: An unpleasant texture
reviews.comments: I purchased the serum in spring. It is sticky, also hard to spread evenly. Doesn't work with moisturizer or foundation. The residue on finger looks like a thin pale film. Hard to dispense from the bottle. Suggest to improve the packaging. Do not recommend.

reviews.headline: Light and easy to use, but not ideal for sensitive skin
reviews.comments: The formula has a gritty texture which irritates my sensitive skin (burns), but it's light enough and easy to apply

reviews.headline: Hate the texture
reviews.comments: Used twice and threw away. Silicone like texture is a no for me. Hate the way it feels on my skin, like it sits on top rather than soak in.

reviews.headline: Brightens and Hydrates
reviews.comments: I received this product complimentary in exchange for my honest review. This is a bit on the denser, lotion side and has a light to fair, skintone coloration. I feel the color of it gives a brightening appearance to my under eye areas. It does make my skin feel rather silky soft and hydrated. I haven't seen any permanent results as far as lightening goes, as I've only been using this for 2 weeks. Happily I haven't had any uncomfortable sensation, nor any irritation from this Vitamin C product.

reviews.headline: Skin is looking better
reviews.comments: I received this product complimentary in exchange for my honest review. This has a slightly denser type of lotion consistency. I can feel a slight tingle with this sometimes in weakened areas of my skin. But, it's slight and quickly dissipates. I did have some pilling in the beginning, but adjusted my other products and that alleviated the issue. As far as how it makes my skin feel, not greasy, definitely refined more than prior to my 2 weeks of use at this point. I cannot attest to brightening attributes at this short time of usage. I have not experience any skin irritation issues from the use of this product.

reviews.headline: Great idea but not safe
reviews.comments: All the different purposes this BeautyStat Universal C Skin Refiner Brightening Vitamin C Serum can be used for is great! It's also wonderful how much pure vitamin c is in it, that it is fragrance free, and can be applied to all types of skin! At the same time though it also contains many harmful, toxic ingredients that unfortunately makes it not safe and cancels out its benefits. If It was made without those ingredients and with only natural, healthy ones then it would be perfect and super helpful!

reviews.headline: Beautiful results you will see over and over again!
reviews.comments: I am loving my results from this Universal C Eye Protector from BeautyStat. The thick texture absorbsevenly without having to use much. My eye area looks bright and my eyes look awake. This formula immediately soothes my skin while leaving a soft and radiant look. Puffiness and fine lines are diminished instantly. The peptides and caffeine help me achieve the best looking eye area. I will be using again and again.

reviews.headline: Excellent product
reviews.comments: The texture of the serum is some kind of watery-gel, it spreads well on the skin and is quickly absorbed. After absorption, there remains a stickiness, quite tolerable, and a beautiful honey glow. During this time, I can definitely say that the skin tone has become more even, but the sun pigmentation, of course, has not lightened. What is most pleasing is that the traces of post-acne are gradually disappearing and the small comedones in the chin area have almost completely disappeared.

reviews.headline: 4 days in and I'm undecided..
reviews.comments:
overall, the texture is nice and light and it's definitely hydrating. however, it feels a little gritty at first, which is kinda weird. my eyelids also feel slightly itchy after applying, BUT they don't get red at all. it might be the vitamin c working? hopefully that goes away but if it doesn't I'll have to stop using because it's driving me nuts. 

I'm torn about it, but I'll keep using it for a couple more days because I've never seen a product like this before. the ingredients look clean to me (paula's choice ingredient checker) so I'm not sure what the other reviewer is talking about. the ingredients are actually pretty impressive!

reviews.headline: Good intentions but needs better ingredients
reviews.comments: This Universal C Eye Perfector purposes are wonderful and how easy it is to use is great as well! I especially love how little the amount needed is and how that stretches the bottle and makes it last longer! It being fragrance free is wonderful but I do not like and it is not good how many other unhealthy, toxic ingredients are in it, which makes it not safe to use. If it was made without any harmful ingredients, then it would be perfect and super helpful!

reviews.headline: My wake me up
reviews.comments: I received this complimentary in exchange for my honest review. If you're like me and you sometimes look like you've just pulled an all-nighter (even when you haven't), this little gem might just be your new best friend. First off, the texture is super smooth and creamy without feeling heavy. It glides on effortlessly, which is a huge plus when you're trying to pat something around your delicate eye area. No one wants to tug at their skin, right? Now, let's get to the star of the show: the Vitamin C! It's like a burst of sunshine for your under-eyes. I've noticed my dark circles looking a bit more manageable and my skin feeling brighter after consistent use. Plus, it has that lovely glow that makes you look more awake‚Äîdefinitely a win!

faceoff_positive.comments:
As other reviewers mentioned, the texture of the product is not the easiest to work with, especially when it comes to trying to layer the product. However, after a few months of use, with lots of trial and error that involved pilling and adjusting my routine around this product, I LOVE IT. I will say if you are looking for a Vitamin C product that has a true serum feel and is easily layers with other products right off the batt, this may not be for you. However, if you truly want the results a high potency vitamin C serum has to offer and are willing to spend some time to fit it into your routine to get those results, this is the one! Because it is a strong formula, I definitely recommend starting out use with one or two times a week as your skin tolerates it. I have pretty resilient skin when it comes to sensitivity but this formula IS strong and could be considered harsh IMO. but I don't mind that when the product really works. 

Texture: As other reviewers said, this product is not smooth immediately upon application. It comes out of the bottle looking like a thick cream but sinks into the skin like a serum like sinks in FAST. There are small (one could say sharp) beads in the formula that break down and dissipate as your apply it.  But that's if the skin is properly prepped for the product. When trying to apply this over other serums, toners, Essence, ect. The texture does not play well with layering in the wrong order. This is confusing IMO especially when trying to follow the "thin to thick" layering method because it is a thick consistency out of the bottle. It pills up reallllyy badly and feels gritty when put over/under something else in the wrong order. However, once you find the order IT wants to be applied, it applies beautifully, leaves a very soft, dry finish and sinks in really nice. 

My thoughts on layering with the texture: The product definitely has to be applied correctly in order to even sink into the skin. Directions say to apply to clean dry skin and this is how it should be applied. It does pill up even over some toners/essences. But now that my skin is acclimated to the product and can tolerate it, I find it works best when applied to skin wet with toner/Essence. This is how I can even use it with an essence before it. However, this is only true for a select few toners. I basically "test" a tiny amount of the next product on my lover jaw to see it it will pill, if not it's a winner and I know I can apply it without pilling. Really annoying IMO. If a product pills up when put over this, I try applying it first and use the same method to test for pilling. When layering with this, you want to wait until products are totally dry and have sunk into the skin before applying the next. (Except when it is just a toner and then this but I don't recommend this as it's not recommended on the bottle, it's just what works for me) As I mentioned above, there are small sharp beads in the formula, they do not dissolve if the skin is prepped wrong. Now that I can use this without pilling or the beads sitting on the skin, the beads go away before they scratch the skin and I enjoy them/don't notice them. 

Results: I can't find it now, but I read somewhere about using this with retinoids (it's so effective you may find you don't need them) and honestly, this product does work better than some retinoids I've used. With consistent use you WILL see results. I saw results with this, even just minor, after the first day of use. Texture, dark marks, and overall skin health has improved with this. More than any other vitamin c I've used. It has also helped my acne tremendously which I can't say any vitamin c has done at all. I get less breakouts and they heal faster and with less scars. 

Final thoughts: this would be an easy 5 stars if the texture wasn't so difficult to work with. Texture alone is a 2 But the results are so good it brings it back to a 4 for me.  Because of the In ability to layer some products that are non negotiable for me, I use this once a day,(usually in the evening because this is a very stable vitamin c that I can use a retinoid with and I want it to be able to do it's best work which I'm sleeping) and apply the products that don't work well with it in the morning/evening that I don't use this, along with an alternative vitamin c serum. The results I've seen with this are good enough that I will continue to use it and have already purchased a backup. The wonders it's don't for my acne alone are enough, not to mention how much brighter and healthy my skin looks.
faceoff_positive.headline: Texture is finicky as other reviewers said, BUT

faceoff_negative.comments:
I have a few things I'm looking for in a Vit C serum. First, I'd prefer it be ascorbic acid (rather than a derivative) and it must be in a pump or other enclosed bottle. I'd also like some literature or discussion of it's stability (ferulic acid, Vit E, etc).  I saw this and as really impressed my the founder's story, I liked the packaging and appreciated that it was a more stable formula. I also really liked supporting a Black-owned business. Unfortunately things went downhill the second I received it.  

First, the pump didn't work. I tried and tried and tried to pump until the product would dispense but nothing.  After a few days of pumping maybe 30 times each, it started dispensing.  Other reviews mention this as well, so it's not just me.  I thought that was the end of it but, sporadically, the pump will decide not to work again and I have to pump it forever (enough that I have to wonder if I'm out or if it will never work again) until finally it works again.  

The next thing that bothered me is that it's texture is really weird.  When I rub my palms together to apply it, it just disappears.  It almost feels like you are left with powder on your hands.  I finally realized that there is actually some product still on there so I applied it to my face.  I don't have very sensitive skins so it doesn't irritate me. UNLESS I have any kind of open wound or acne blemish, then it stings like crazy for about 30-60 seconds. But I really hate the texture. It's powdery and drying.  And when I apply sunscreen over it (even after letting it sit), it will pill up.  

It does seem effective but it's hard to really tell since I have used Vit C in my routine for years so I'm assuming that since my skin hasn't reverted, it's working properly?  I haven't found my perfect Vit C yet so the search continues.
faceoff_negative.headline: I wanted to love it, but just no
